title: Address
content:
CommentComponent(kind=text, text=Addresses for , value=) CommentComponent(kind=typeName, text=FunctionInstance, value=kwasm.runtime.FunctionInstance) CommentComponent(kind=text, text=s, , value=) CommentComponent(kind=typeName, text=Memory, value=kwasm.runtime.Address.Memory) CommentComponent(kind=text, text=s, , value=) CommentComponent(kind=typeName, text=Table, value=kwasm.runtime.Address.Table) CommentComponent(kind=text, text=s, and , value=) CommentComponent(kind=typeName, text=Global, value=kwasm.runtime.Address.Global) CommentComponent(kind=text, text=s.

From the docs:

Function instances, table instances, memory instances, and global instances in the store are referenced with abstract addresses. These are simply indices into the respective store component.


addr       ::= 0|1|2|...
funcaddr   ::= addr
tableaddr  ::= addr
memaddr    ::= addr
globaladdr ::= addr

An embedder may assign identity to exported store objects corresponding to their addresses, even where this identity is not observable from within WebAssembly code itself (such as for function instances or immutable globals).

, value=null)
